attributes.action: Establish Justice in the  courts via further amendments of the Race Relations Amendment Act 2000 [Banning  Section 19 C]  & by Ordering a re trial of  the ‘Death by careless Driving’ ruling case of Kaya Bousquet, Patience Ncube and Danielle Campbell.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In 2008[name withheld], a lorry driver was found’ not guilty’ of causing  ‘Death by Dangerous Driving’ of Kaya Bousquet[23],Patience Ncube[22] and Danielle Campbell [23]in Wood Green Crown Court. Instead he was ordered to pay £500 in court costs & banned from driving for a year.

The girls car was stationary when it was rammed by XXXXs 40 ton truck which had failed to break on time.

In the Trial: the majority of the Jurors were made up of mainly non car drivers & as such did not know the Legal requirements i.e Highway code eg. breaking distance. The coroner did not find any traces of alcohol in Danielle’s blood. The police scientist reports supported the claim that the hazard lights were switched on shortly after the girls Toyota Yaris lost power & that the truck driver only applied his brakes (partially) one second after impact despite giving evidence to the contrary.

Section 19 C of the Race Relations Amendment Act 2000 states that Judges and anyone working for the courts i.e Jurors can discriminate against a black or ethnic minority in the court of Law.

rejection.details: We cannot accept petitions on individual legal cases, as they are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office. More guidance can be found here: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms
